channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With new cuts at CDC, some fear there's 'nobody to answer the phone'
item.description: More than 1,300 staffers at the health agency got notices they were fired — but more than half were reinstated. The cuts will hobble some divisions, employees say.
item.content:encoded:
More than 1,300 staffers at the health agency got notices they were fired — but more than half were reinstated. The cuts will hobble some divisions, employees say.

(Image credit: Dustin Chambers/Bloomberg)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Trump awards the Medal of Freedom posthumously to Charlie Kirk
item.description: President Trump presented the award to Kirk's widow, Erika Kirk, in the White House Rose Garden on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump presented the award to Kirk's widow, Erika Kirk, in the White House Rose Garden on Tuesday.

(Image credit: Rebecca Noble)
item.dc:creator: Elena Moore

item.title: In new memoir, John T. Edge explores Southern identity and a troubled family history
item.description: Writer John T. Edge has spent much of his career telling stories about a changing American South filtered through the lens of food and culture. Now he's talking about his troubled family's history.
item.content:encoded:
Writer John T. Edge has spent much of his career telling stories about a changing American South filtered through the lens of food and culture. Now he's talking about his troubled family's history.

(Image credit: Debbie Elliott)
item.dc:creator: Debbie Elliott

item.title: Afghan earthquake triggers contradictory Taliban tactics on rescuing women
item.description: The Taliban responded with contradictory stances in the effort to rescue women and girls who were wounded and left homeless. That's a reflection of tensions between hardliners and pragmatists.
item.content:encoded:
The Taliban responded with contradictory stances in the effort to rescue women and girls who were wounded and left homeless. That's a reflection of tensions between hardliners and pragmatists.

(Image credit: Wakil Kohsar/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Diaa Hadid

item.title: Military seizes power in Madagascar following anti-government protests
item.description: The army in Madagascar seized power on Tuesday, days after the president went into hiding saying he feared for his life after several weeks of massive anti-government protests.
item.content:encoded:
The army in Madagascar seized power on Tuesday, days after the president went into hiding saying he feared for his life after several weeks of massive anti-government protests.  

(Image credit: Brian Inganga)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: A fragile Gaza ceasefire is tested after Israel and Hamas swap detainees and hostages
item.description: Israel and Hamas took steps toward ending the two-year war that has devastated the Gaza Strip, but hard work lies ahead.
item.content:encoded:
Israel and Hamas took steps toward ending the two-year war that has devastated the Gaza Strip, but hard work lies ahead.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: Jane Arraf

item.title: What's next for Gaza. And, ICE tactics are reportedly becoming more violent
item.description: With the first phase of a ceasefire holding, eyes are on what is next for Gaza. And, ICE agents are ramping up arrest operations in several cities and raising concerns about their tactics.
item.content:encoded:
With the first phase of a ceasefire holding, eyes are on what is next for Gaza. And, ICE agents are ramping up arrest operations in several cities and raising concerns about their tactics.

(Image credit: Mosab Shawer)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Maine Gov. Janet Mills enters crowded Democratic race to unseat Susan Collins
item.description: Mills was reportedly recruited by Democratic Senate leaders after her high-profile confrontation with President Trump in February, in which she told the president she'd "see you in court."
item.content:encoded:
Mills was reportedly recruited by Democratic Senate leaders after her high-profile confrontation with President Trump in February, in which she told the president she'd "see you in court."

(Image credit: Robert F. Bukaty)
item.dc:creator: Steve Mistler

item.title: A Nobel Prize for explaining when technology leads to growth
item.description: The 2025 Nobel Prize in economics was awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 Nobel Prize in economics was awarded to Joel Mokyr, Philippe Aghion and Peter Howitt.

(Image credit: Jonathan Nackstrand)
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: GOP 'afraid to do anything' unless Trump approves, says Virginia Sen. Tim Kaine
item.description: Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia says shutdown can end if Trump engages more earnestly in negotiations.
item.content:encoded:
Democratic Sen. Tim Kaine of Virginia says shutdown can end if Trump engages more earnestly in negotiations.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin
